page.title: 19Social Concerns in the '80s
page.content: Today's pace of life is so fast that many people have turned to drink,drugs and glue sniffing. This, coupled with lack of{employment}creates many { {social concerns.}Sometimes all that people need is a place to go where someone will understand their problem. The Gateway Exchange is a place where people can go for support. The person who started Gateway was in prison with his own problems and, when he got out, he realised how hard it is to cope. The centre provides a wide variety of activities such as group meetings,{ {arts and crafts.}The people who run Gateway are volunteers. It is financed by donations and the organisers have refused government aid as they want a free hand in how it is run. People's{ {attitudes}to Gateway are mostly good as there is a need for support for people with problems.
